ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Staff code number of person completing this form
Check if the Assessment was not done.
Does the subject continue to meet the inclusion exclusion criteria?
Is the subject eligible for randomization?
What condition is the patient randomized to?

Notes: "1=Failed to meet inclusion criteria; 2=Withdrew consent; 3=Medical reason (AE, illness, etc); 4=Non-compliance with protocol treatment; 5=Subject requires prohibited medication; 0=Other"
System variable: unique code for each type of visit -use to merge files

The FSEQNO variable in the ADJ form has a special interpretation compared to other forms.
For example, ADJ FSEQNO of '1' can be thought of as being '001', FSEQNO of '2' can be thought of as
being '002', and FSEQNO of '3' can be thought of as being '003'.
The first digit of FSEQNO relates to the corresponding ENF sequence number at that visit and the third
digit relates to the specific adjudicator who completed the adjudication form.

ElementDescription: Does the patient still give consent to participate in the study?

Do you need a bottle code for the oral trial?
Number of days from study baseline to date of visit
Study; The code for each individual study

Notes: 1 = Toxicity or side effects related to study medication; 2 = Medical reason unrelated to study medication; 3 = Termination by principal investigator because of non medical reasons; 4 = Failed to return to clinic; 5 = Declined study participation; 6 = Moved from area (current or pending); 7 = Death; 8 = Subject no longer eligible to participate; 9 = School unable/no longer willing to participate; 10 = Other

ElementDescription: Order of Enrollment - The first subject enrolled in the Guanfacine  Trial (i.e., the earliest enrollment date)  has ENRL_ORD = 1, the second subject enrolled has ENRL_ORD = 2, the third has ENRL_ORD = 3, etc.  Subjects enrolled on the same day are given the same number.

Notes: 1=Failed to meet inclusion or exclusion criteria; 2=Declined study participation/Withdrew consent; 3=Failed to return to clinic; 4=Moved from area; 5=Incarceration; 6=Death; 7=Other; -9=Unknown
1=Escitalopram plus Orange capsule-Lexapro; 2=Bupropion-SR plus Blue capsule-Wellbutrin; 3=Venlafaxine XR plus Green capsule-Effexor
1=start treatment with ketamine; 2= start treatment with saline; -9 =unknown

ElementDescription: Randomly Assigned to Clinical Behavior Therapy?

Notes: 1 = YES for all patients; YES for all patients became active when study stopped using paroxetine.

-1.5 = Pre-Screening; -1 = Screening; 0 = Baseline; ## = Visit ## (from 1 to 10); Whole numbers = standard monthly visits; #.001 - #.009 = Unscheduled; #.1 = End of Phase 1; #.2 = End of Phase 2; #.3 = End of Phase 3; #.4 = End of Open Choice Phase; #.5 = End of Study; #.6 = Genetic Analysis; 1000=all visits
